text:
="preserve">Gruffudd ap Llywelyn ap Iorwerth (c. 1200 – 1 March 1244) was the Welsh first-born son of Llywelyn the Great ("Llywelyn Fawr").
Life.
During his life, he was a hostage of King John (John Lackland).
Gruffudd was probably born c. 1199 - c. 1205 as his mother Tangwystl was believed to have died c. 1206.
Death.
He dies after failing an attempt to escape the Tower of London.
